column4: What is the command to show new usb connections? (i thought it was something like.. tail -0f .. ?)
would the command "dmesg" help?
well i kinda wanna see it register devices when i plug them in
dmesg gives timestamps... I don't know of anything that observes it live.
there is, its something with tail -0f /var/... or something
the command was "tail -f /var/log/messages"
start using synaptic..
why would I want to start using synaptic?
easier to get to the thing you need when you dont know the complete name..
I don't really think so. I find synaptic confusing. I really prefer the terminal.
start synaptic, press search, type ubuntu, scroll all the way down and you will find the thing you're looking for..
btw i dont have that package installed (the ubuntu-restricted-extras) and i can play .mp3 files with rythmbox so its not that
it's not as simple as that....

hmm some guy also had the problem and this fixed it for him "i found a solution for this problem. You have to change the output plugin in gstreamer-properties to OSS. It seems to be a problem of alsa or the alsa plugin of gstreamer."
link?
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=188956
that problem is not at all like mine.
nm.
part of it is.., anyhow others fixed it by installing "gstreamer0.10-plugins" but you already done that right ?
heh search for it in synaptic :P but sec i'll try to find the right apt-get command to test it
I wanted the command that tells you the version, it has slipped my mind. :\
the svn thingy ?
that doesn't ring a bell, but maybe?
its easier to check what you have installed with synaptic so far i know.. just search for "gstreamer0.10-plugins" and you can see what you got installed
